summary: This paper introduces a novel pre-training technique, 'query-as-context pre-training,' to address the issue of weakly correlated passages in context-supervised pre-training methods. The approach demonstrates improved performance on multiple datasets, but the paper still lacks sufficient detail on experimental setup and statistical rigor, although the authors have clarified some aspects of their work.

strengths.text: The paper clearly positions its work relative to prior art, identifying gaps and introducing a novel pre-training technique. (Intro ยง1.2, Intro, Related Work) [novelty]
strengths.grounding: Intro ยง1.2, Intro, Related Work

strengths.text: The paper evaluates models on 14 publicly available datasets from the BEIR benchmark and demonstrates improved performance on MS-MARCO and TREC DL datasets. (Sec 4.5, Table 1, Table 2) [claims_vs_evidence]
The use of bold font to highlight the better scores in each comparison enhances readability and quickly identifies the superior performance. (Tables 1, 2, 3, 5) [tables]
The paper is generally well organized with clear sectioning. (Intro ยง1) [organization]

weaknesses.text: The paper lacks sufficient details on the pretraining and fine-tuning processes, including the environment used for experiments. (Sec 4, Section 4) [reproducibility]

The paper claims effectiveness and efficiency, but evidence for efficiency is missing. Also, the paper does not report seeds, variance, or statistical significance (e.g., standard deviations, p-values). (Sec 7, Section 4.5, Tables 1, 2, 3, 4, 5) [claims_vs_evidence]
The definition of 'query-as-context pre-training' could be more precise, and the paper lacks a clear notation section. (Abstract, Intro, Methods section (if any)) [clarity_presentation]
The paper does not explicitly compare its performance against the methods described in [1] and [3]. (Related Work) [comparison]

Dataset license and usage restrictions are not stated for MS-MARCO and TREC Deep Learning datasets, and there is no discussion of potential misuse or failure modes. (Insufficient evidence) [ethics_licensing]
Figure 3 lacks detailed axis labels, making it difficult to interpret the fine-tuning pipeline. (Fig 3) [figures]

suggestions.text: Provide a more detailed description of the experimental setup, including the specific datasets used, evaluation metrics, and a link to the code repository with environment details. (Sec 4.5, All sections) [experimental design]

Report the seed used for all experiments and the variance across multiple runs, including standard deviations or confidence intervals and p-values. (Section 4.5, Tables 1, 2, 3, 4, 5) [seeds/variance]
Add explicit license and consent statements for datasets used and a Broader Impact section with mitigation strategies. (Insufficient evidence, Conclusion) [ethics_licensing]
Provide a more detailed explanation of the query generation process and include a notation table to define all symbols used in equations. (Methods section (if any)) [clarity_presentation]
In Figure 2, add error bars to indicate the variance in performance. (Fig 2) [figures]
